title: Development of Science Learning Motivation Design Strategies Using Fully Immersive Virtual Reality (FIVR)

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of science education theories, basic concepts of virtual reality, and foundational instructional design competencies
context.additional_context: Project-based course for pre-service/in-service teachers to design and analyze FIVR-based strategies for enhancing science learning motivation.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain the impact of FIVR technology on three or more science learning motivation factors (interest, self-efficacy, engagement).
Learners can derive five core principles to consider when designing FIVR simulations for physics-based science concept education.
Learners can develop and evaluate a FIVR instructional design framework compatible with BYOD approaches in small-scale learning environments.

resources: Learning motivation measurement questionnaire (e.g., SMSQ, IMMS)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
